labels.analysis: The MCP Server for CircleCI is designed to bridge natural language interaction with CircleCI's CI/CD functionality. It allows users to retrieve build logs, analyze failures, and manage CI/CD processes directly from their development environment, effectively integrating CI/CD tasks into the IDE workflow.
labels.reasoning: The primary label is chosen because the server's core functionality revolves around automating and managing CI/CD (Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment) processes through natural language interactions. The secondary label of Development Tools is included because it automation capabilities within developer workflows.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: CircleCI MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @CircleCI-Public/mcp-server-circleci
server_info_crawled.overview: Enable natural language interactions with CircleCI functionality through MCP-enabled clients. Use this server to retrieve build logs, analyze failures, and manage your CI/CD processes seamlessly from your IDE. Simplify your workflow by integrating CircleCI commands directly into your development environment.

tools.name: get_build_failure_logs
tools.description: Deploy Server CircleCI MCP Server @CircleCI-Public/mcp-server-circleci Try in Playground get_build_failure_logs

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@CircleCI-Public/mcp-server-circleci/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())

smithery_configuration_requirements.name: circleciToken
smithery_configuration_requirements.description: CircleCI API token with read access to CircleCI projects
